page.title: 17LAND USE IN RURAL CORNWALL
page.content: The area is dominated by the imposing {Dreasonball Woods}which stands sentinel over Dreason Farm. Land cover in the area is primarily agricutural and ranges from rough grazing, unimproved grassland to barley and silage.Both sheep and heifers graze on this undulating pasture.The majority of grazing is on the north and east of dresonball wood where the {slopes }are steepest. The only crops{cultivated} aregrown on the gentler and milder slopes of the south and West. The predominant form of woodland in the area is deciduous although this is interspesred occasionally with coniferous woodland. the other obvious examples of land cover are the two modes of {transport}in evidence - the main road from Bodmin to Plymouth and the main railway into the Southwest.
